https://prez.dev/description.@value: The primary purpose for which a borehole was drilled or any secondary purpose that the borehole may acquire during its lifecycle. The vocabulary focuses on drilling purposes within the resources industry, with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. Some terms covered by jurisdictional legislation are highlighted in the provenance field. Variations in terminology within definitions (i.e. usage of borehole, well and wellbore) stem from usage in different sectors of the resources industry, but for the purpose of this vocabulary are considered to be equivalent. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium).

A well drilled to inject fluids (e.g. CO₂) into deep subsurface rock formations for long-term storage. The process is also referred to as geosequestration (GS) in general, or more specifically as 'carbon capture and storage' (CCS) in the case of CO₂ or 'greenhouse gas storage' (GHG). Fluids are commonly captured from an industrial (e.g. steel and cement production) or energy-related source (e.g. a power plant or natural gas processing facility).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A borehole/well drilled to examine the subsurface's ability to accommodate the temporary / permanent storage of gases and liquids, and to implement such storage.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Definition compiled by the Geological Survey of Western Australia.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: A borehole/well drilled to examine the subsurface's ability to accommodate the temporary / permanent storage of gases and liquids, and to implement such storage.
A well used to inject and subsequently recover natural gas or other gaseous material (e.g. manufactured hydrogen) into/from subsurface rock formations.

https://prez.dev/label.@value: transient storage - liquids other than water

https://prez.dev/description.@value: A borehole/well used for the injection or withdrawal of liquid or liquefied hydrocarbons into or out of an underground hydrocarbon storage facility, including salt caverns.
